intro: Micromeria debilis var. mauritii, commonly known as the Mauritius micromeria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence, while its flowers are small and yellow, typical of the Rutaceae family. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its island environment.
